All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddChatMessageCommand
Represents a command to add a chat message received from the server to the client's chat interface.
AlreadySetCardException
Exception thrown when an attempt is made to set a card that has already been set.
AwaitingReconnectionState
Represents the game state where the server is awaiting reconnection from any disconnected player.
AwaitingReconnectionState
Represents the state of the game client where the game is paused awaiting reconnection from disconnected players.
BroadcastMessageCommand
Represents a server command to broadcast a message from the server to all clients.
Card
Represents a generic card in the game, providing common properties that exist for all types of cards.
CardDeck<T>
Represents a deck of cards used in the game, allowing cards to be drawn, shuffled, and managed in a stack, with visibility of the top one.
CardGeneratorJSONParser
Utility class to generate JSON files by parsing the objects on the server when modifications to the graphical resources of cards on the TUI are required.
CardNotInHandException
Exception thrown when an action which requires to own the card in hand to execute it is done without satisfying this condition.
ChooseInitialCardsState
Represents the initial state where players choose how to place their starting cards.
ChooseInitialCardsState
Represents the state of the game client where the player needs to on which side to place the initial card on the game board.
ChooseObjectiveCardsState
Represents the state where players choose their secret objective cards.
ChooseObjectiveCardsState
Represents the state of the game client where the player needs to choose the personal objective card.
Client
The Client class represents a client in a client-server communication setup.
ClientCard
Represents a client-side card in the game, including its unique identifier, graphical user interface (GUI) sprites, and text user interface (TUI) sprites.
ClientCommand
Interface that represents a client command to be executed on the client side.
ClientController
The ClientController class manages client-side operations and interactions with the game server.
ClientControllerInterface
The ClientControllerInterface extends ControllerInterface to provide methods specific to client-side operations in response to an action required by the Server.
ClientGame
Represents a client-side game that extends the Room.
ClientJSONParser
Utility class to handle JSON parsing and serialization for various card types on the client.
ClientMain
Entry point for the client application.
ClientPlayer
Represents a client-side player extending the Player class.
Color
An enumeration of the possible players' colors and the one which represents the player who plays first.
Command
Represents a generic command in this application.
Commons
A utility class that contains common methods used in different contexts of the code.
ConfirmSelectionCommand
Represents a client command to confirm the selection of an objective card.
ConnectionController
The ConnectionController class extends the ServerController and manages the initial connection state of players, handling operations like setting nicknames, creating lobbies, and joining lobbies.
ConnectionSetupState
Represents the connection setup state of the client-side view.
ControllerInterface
The ControllerInterface serves as a common interface for the controllers present in the application, providing a unified type for managing different aspects of the application.
CornersCondition
A condition that counts how many corners are covered when playing the associated card.
CreateLobbyCommand
Represents a server command to create a new lobby with a specified maximum number of players.
CreatePlayerCommand
Represents a server command to create a new player with a specified nickname.
DirectMessageCommand
Represents a server command to send a direct message from the server to a specific client.
DrawFromDeckCommand
Represents a server command to draw a card from a specified deck.
DrawFromVisibleCardsCommand
Represents a server command to draw a card from the visible cards of a specified deck.
EmptyDeckException
Exception thrown when an attempt to perform an operation on a deck is called on an empty one.
EndGameCommand
Represents a client command to notify the end of the game and send the final points statistics.
ErrorLogger
A utility class for logging errors with extra information such as timestamp and context.
Field
Represents a field that stores the cards placed by a player and manages the open corners where the next cards can be played according to the rules
ForbiddenActionException
Exception thrown when attempting to perform an action that is forbidden or not allowed by the state of the game or the context in which the player is.
FullLobbyException
Exception thrown when an attempt is made to join a lobby that is already full.
Game
Represents a game session after it has started, keeping track of the players in the associated game lobby.
GameController
The GameController class extends the ServerController and manages the game state, handling player actions such as placing cards, picking objectives, and drawing from decks.
GameScreenState
Represents an abstract game screen state, providing common functionalities for different game states.
GameState
The abstract base class representing a state in the game.
GameTransitionCommand
Represents a client command to transition the game state to the next phase or round.
GenericPair<T1,T2>
A pair of generic elements.
GoldCard
Represents a Gold Card in the game's card set, which grants points based on particular conditions and requires resources to be played.
GUIApplication
Represents the main JavaFX application for the Graphical User Interface implementation.
GUIConnectionLoadingView
Singleton class representing the connection setup view in the Graphical User Interface (GUI).
GUIConnectionSetupView
Singleton class representing the connection setup view in the Graphical User Interface (GUI).
GUIGameView
The GUIGameView class represents the Graphical User Interface (GUI) view for displaying the game and all the details composing the game board.
GUILobbiesView
Singleton class representing the lobbies view in the Graphical User Interface (GUI).
GUITitleView
Singleton class representing the title view in the Graphical User Interface (GUI).
GUIView
Singleton class representing the Graphical User Interface (GUI) view.
InGamePlayer
Represents a player who is currently in a game.
InitialCard
Represents an Initial Card in the game's card set.
InvalidCardPositionException
Exception thrown when an attempt is made to place a card on a coordinate pair which is already full or is invalid by the constraints given by the field displacement.
InvalidCardTypeException
Exception thrown when an attempt to perform a specific operation which requires a specific type of card with an incompatible one is made.
InvalidDeckPositionException
Exception thrown when an attempt to pick a card with and index greater than the number of possible choices is made.
JoinLobbyCommand
Represents a server command for a client to join a lobby identified by its UUID.
JSONParser
Utility class to handle JSON parsing and serialization for various card types and conditions.
KeepAliveCommand
Represents a command used to maintain session persistence between client and server.
LeaderboardScreenState
Represents the leaderboard screen state of the client-side view.
LeaveGameCommand
Represents a server command for a client to leave the current game.
LeaveLobbyCommand
Represents a server command for a client to leave the current lobby.
Listenable
A marker interface for objects that can have listeners attached to them.
Listener
Represents a listener that handles notifications received by an external source.
LobbiesScreenState
Represents the lobbies screen state of the client-side view.
Lobby
Represents a game lobby where players wait for new games to start.
LobbyController
The LobbyController class extends the ServerController and is responsible for managing operations within a game lobby, such as player actions and transitioning from the lobby to an active game.
NetworkListener
Represents a listener that handles notifications received by an external source.
NetworkSession
Represents a network session established between a client and the server.
NotEnoughResourcesException
Exception thrown when an attempt to place a card with a ResourceCondition without the resources needed to perform this action is made.
NotExistingPlayerException
Exception thrown when a request to perform an action involves a player who is unknown to the server.
ObjectiveCard
Represents an Objective Card in the game's card set.
OverlayPopup
Utility class extending the functionalities of the JavaFX Popup class.
PatternCondition
A condition that counts how many "disjoint" times the condition pattern can be found among the played cards.
PauseGameCommand
Represents a client command to pause the current game.
PickColorCommand
Represents a server command for a client to pick a color.
PickObjectiveCommand
Represents a server command for a client to pick an objective card.
PlaceCardCommand
Represents a client command to place a card on the game board.
PlaceCardCommand
Represents a server command for a client to place a card on the board.
PlayableCard
Represents a standard playable card in the game's card set.
Player
Represents a player outside of games, typically in a lobby.
PlayerTurnDrawState
Represents the game state where players draw cards during their turn.
PlayerTurnDrawState
Represents the state where a player is allowed to draw cards during their turn.
PlayerTurnPlayState
Represents the game state where players can place cards on the field if it's their turn.
PlayerTurnPlayState
Represents the state where a player is playing their turn by placing cards on the field, moving the field view, or interacting with other players through messages.
PointsCondition
A standard method to compute conditions to assign points.
ReceiveCardCommand
Represents a client command to receive a card.
ReceiveObjectiveChoiceCommand
Represents a client command to receive objective card choices.
ReplaceCardsCommand
Represents a client command to replace various types of cards in the game.
Resource
An enumeration of all the possible resource values that can appear in card corners and back-centers.
ResourceCard
Represents a Resource Card in the game's card set.
ResourcesCondition
A condition that counts how many sets of resources of the specified type the player has.
RestoreGameCommand
Represents a client command to restore a game state on the client side.
RMIClientSkeleton
The RMIClientSkeleton class represent the skeleton that the Server must own for handling communication with a remote RMI client.
RMIMainServer
Represents the main server interface for RMI communication in a distributed system.
RMIServerStub
The RMIServerStub class represents the stub that the client must own for handling communication with a remote RMI Server.
RMIVirtualClient
Represents a virtual client interface for RMI communication in a distributed system.
RMIVirtualServer
Represents a virtual server interface for RMI communication in a distributed system.
Room
Represents a generic room where players can be grouped, such as a game lobby or a game.
Server
The Server class represents a server in a client-server communication setup.
ServerCommand
Represents a command to be executed on the server side in response to client requests.
ServerController
The ServerController class is an abstract base class that implements the ServerControllerInterface and provides common functionality for various types of server controllers in the application.
ServerControllerInterface
The ServerControllerInterface extends ControllerInterface to define methods specific to server-side operations in response to requests from clients or triggered by the fulfillment of certain conditions.
ServerJSONParser
Utility class to handle JSON parsing and serialization for various card types and conditions on the server.
ServerListener
Represents a listener that handles notifications sent by the server to clients.
ServerMain
Entry point for the server application.
ServerModel
Represents the server-side model responsible for managing game and lobby controllers.
SetLobbiesCommand
Represents a client command to set the lobbies on the client side.
SetNicknameCommand
Represents a command to set a nickname for a client session, implemented as both a ServerCommand and a ClientCommand.
SetPlayerActivityCommand
Represents a client command to change the activity status of a player.
Side
An enumeration of the side which the card can be placed.
SocketClient
Represents a client socket connection to a server in a networked environment.
SocketClientHandler
The SocketClientHandler class represents a handler for managing communication with the client connected to this server.
SocketHandler
The SocketHandler class is an abstract representation of a network session utilizing socket-based communication in a client-server architecture.
SocketServerHandler
The SocketServerHandler class represents a handler for managing communication with the server connected to this client.
StartGameCommand
Represents a client command to start a game on the client side.
ThrowExceptionCommand
Represents a client command to throw an exception on the client side.
TitleScreenState
Represents the title screen state of the client-side view.
Triplet<T1,T2,T3>
A triplet of generic elements.
TUIConnectionView
Singleton class representing the connection setup view in the Terminal User Interface (TUI).
TUIGameView
The TUIGameView class represents the Textual User Interface (TUI) view for displaying the game and all the details composing the game board.
TUILobbiesView
Singleton class representing the lobbies view in the Terminal User Interface (TUI).
TUIParser
Singleton class responsible for parsing and executing commands input through the Terminal User Interface (TUI).
TUITitleView
Singleton class representing the title view in the Terminal User Interface (TUI).
TUIView
Singleton class representing the Terminal User Interface (TUI) view.
UnavailableColorException
Exception thrown when a request to select a color which is already taken by someone else is made.
UnexpectedPlayerException
Exception thrown when a request to perform an action involves a player who is not supposed to perform such action at that moment.
UnknownStringException
Exception thrown when the received string does not match any of the expected strings in the given context.
UpdateLobbyCommand
Represents a client command to update the state of a lobby on the client side.
VictoryCalculationState
Represents the game state where victory points are calculated and the game ends.
View
Abstract base class representing the view of a client-side application.
ViewModel
Represents the client's view model, managing the player's nickname related to the client, the list of game lobbies, and the current lobby or game if the player is in it.
ViewState
Abstract base class representing a state in the client-side view.
VirtualClient
The VirtualClient interface represents a client entity in a networked environment, providing a contract for communication between the server and the client.
VirtualServer
The VirtualServer interface represents a server entity in a networked environment, providing a contract for communication between the server and clients.
